```json
    }, {
        "key": "shift+cmd+,",
        "command": "editor.emmet.action.selectPreviousItem",
        "when": "config.emmet.triggerExpansionOnTab && editorTextFocus && !editorHasMultipleSelections && !editorHasSelection && !editorReadonly && !editorTabMovesFocus"

...
}]
```

data.title: editor.formatOnPaste: Is there a way to control the formatting used when pasting?
data.body:
My team uses "JS Standard Style" formatting, which we have configured via .eslintrc, but it seems that the formatting used when pasting code doesn't necessarily conform to the Standard rules.

For example, copying the following code (which complies with Standard's `"space-before-function-paren": ["error", "always"]` rule
```js
function doSomething (val) {}
```
ends up getting formatted like this upon pasting:
```js
function doSomething(val) {}
```
(notice the space after the function name is gone)

Is there a way to modify this behavior, preferably in a way that "just works" with my eslint configs?

data.title: VS Code uses OSX `cmd + down` convention in the Sidebar Explorer
data.body:
OSX made the wrong choice making `Enter` rename a file in Finder, and VS Code should not make the same mistake.

Can the default behavior in the Sidebar Explorer please be `Enter` > `Open`, `cmd + Enter` > `Rename`?

Or at least make this an easy setting to toggle... following this Finder convention makes using the sidebar a sad time. `cmd + down` to open a file? That's not great.

data.title: Pick up TS 2.2 2/9 insiders build
Add Command to Go To / Create project configuration for an active js or ts file
data.body:
Part of #20356

Adds a new command that opens the `jsconfig` or `tsconfig` project configuration file for the currently active javascript or typescript file. If the file is not part of a project, displays a quick pick that allows users to learn more and create a config file at the root of their project

data.title: Unable to debug the Extension Debugger code in Python Extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 8 and OS X

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download Python repo into the Extension directory:  
```C:\Users\xxx\.vscode\extensions\pythonVSCode```  
```https://github.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode.git```
2. Open the ```pythonVSCode``` directory in VS Code  
```npm install```
```Tasks: Run Build Task```
3. From debug Panel select ```Launch Extension as debug server```  
Output in debug console is as follows:  
```
node --debug-brk=35378 --harmony out\client\debugger\Main.js --server=4712 
Debugger listening on [::]:35378
waiting for debug protocol on port 4712
```
4. Add a breakpoint into the debugger code  
```src\client\debugger\Main.ts```  

5. Open another instance of VS Code   
- Open a folder with a Python file  
- Go into launch.json and add the following:  
```json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "debugServer": 4711,
    "configurations": [{
            "name": "Python",
            "type": "python",
            "request": "launch",
            "stopOnEntry": true,
            "pythonPath": "${config.python.pythonPath}",
            "program": "${file}",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "env": null,
            "envFile": "${workspaceRoot}/.env",
            "debugOptions": [
                "WaitOnAbnormalExit",
                "WaitOnNormalExit",
                "RedirectOutput"
            ]
        },
```
- Start debugging a simple python file with a simple print statement.


6. Expected: Debugger in VS Code should break into the extension debugger code, it doesn't.

***NOTE*** 
- This used to work last year. Not sure when it stopped working.
- No errors displayed in ```Console``` window of ```Developer Tools```

data.title: Add command / status item to show which tsconfig/jsconfig project a file belongs to
data.body:
From the discussion on this issue: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/12618#issuecomment-278745892

Add some way for users to understand which project(s) a JavaScript or TypeScript file belongs to. This could either be a command that users would have to invoke or perhaps a status bar item.

data.title: Show all source code when debugging against a remote process
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3
- Node.js Version: v6.9.4

I have some workflows where my node process is running remotely. I am using VSCode as my debugger front end, attaching the debugger to the remote process. However, VSCode isn't showing the sources from the remote process, which makes it impossible to set breakpoints.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1226256/22805222/6cd1b630-eed1-11e6-8723-194862b24729.png)

As an example, when I attach the WebStorm debugger to the same remote process, I can see all of the source code, including the Node runtime source:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1226256/22804986/53a49bd8-eed0-11e6-82fe-9f8e1d4beacd.png)

Bringing in all of the source code from the remote process would be extremely helpful for our workflow.

data.title: Keyboard settings lock up and change bindings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 (Surfacebook)

Just installed the latest updates for VS Code on my Surfacebook. I typical use the UK layout because when I touch type I don't look at keys and naturally go for the layout I grew up with. On VS Code I switch into the US layout (because I can't use backslash without switching to US).

Whilst using the new version of VS Code if I change pages, the keyboard settings lock up, the keybindings change and when I press certain keys they correspond with neither US nor UK layouts nor Romanian (The only other keyboard I have active).

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode, switch to US Keyboard layout from default UK Layout
2. Type in a file
3. Switch to another file
4. Attempt to type (try using stuff like quote marks - alphanumerical characters seems unaffected)
5. Also note that with VS Code still in focus (important, don't switch to another program), the keyboard switcher (in the bottom right corner) freezes and doesn't work.

The keyboard doesn't switch in any other programs (including other text editors and IDEs), it just seems to have started in VS Code.

milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:44:55.542Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.16.0-4-amd64
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|erb|CraigMaslowski|0.0.1|
|ejs-language-support|QassimFarid|0.0.1|
|vscode-html-to-elm|Rubymaniac|0.0.2|
|haskelly|UCL|0.4.10|
|elm-format|abadi199|0.1.0|
|vscode-caniuse|agauniyal|0.4.0|
|vscode-color|anseki|0.2.3|
|one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.4|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.5|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|an-old-hope-theme-vscode|dustinsanders|1.1.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.8|
|Theme-TwoStones|gerane|0.0.2|
|Theme-monokai-best|gerane|0.0.2|
|hopscotch|idleberg|0.1.4|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|language-polymer|jonwolfe|0.7.10|
|theme-onedark-sublime|joshpeng|0.3.6|
|Theme-MaterialKit|ms-vscode|0.1.1|
|theme-oceanicnext|naumovs|0.0.4|
|java|redhat|0.0.10|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.2.0|
|elm|sbrink|0.8.3|
|theme-tinaciousdesign|tinaciousdesign|0.1.1|
|theme-dop|Tysian|0.1.0|

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a dual-monitor system in place
2. In one monitor launch vscode
2. In the other monitor lauch some other application
3. In vscode toggle fullscreen
4. Interact with the other application, in the other monitor, with the mouse, click on it
5. Try to interact with vscode. It should 'disapear' revealing whatever application is running below it

------

This problem happens with
*   fullscreen
*   zen mode
*   even when launching vscode with --disable-extensions

------

It's easier to see what happens when there's another application running on the same monitor as vscode. (It's not necessary to reproduce though)

------

I've recorded the session to a gif which I'll atach to this issue

In it, at first, I launch an Electron app and then toggle fullscreen, just to see if the problem appears (it doesn't)

Then I toggle fullscreen on vscode and the problem is reproduced

If the application on the other screen is also in fullscreen mode, then the problem doesn't occur - this can be seen in the gif

------

I have experimented with other Electron based apps and this behaviour was not reproduced

![vscode_fullscreen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1664234/22803004/35aa6b88-eefa-11e6-9d13-632a1bd5d722.gif)

data.title: Send Script Kind based on languageId for js and ts files
data.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42139118/is-error-checking-in-vs-code-exclusively-tied-to-the-file-extension

**bug**
When using custom file associations for js/ts files, we do not always open the files against TypeScript with the  correct language mode.

**Fix**
Always send `scriptKind` to Typescript based on the languageId of the file

data.title: webpack-dev-server not working from debugger on Windows 10
data.body:
I have an issue with getting webpack-dev-server to run from the debugger in Visual Studio Code on Windows 10. The project runs perfectly on Linux and Mac, but for some reason it errors out on windows. It also works fine from VSC's tasks implementation, and from the command line on _all platforms_. Thank you in advance for your help.

Please note I have posted this issue in two other places in case this is not a bug in VSC:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42138058/webpack-dev-server-not-working-from-debugger-on-windows-10

https://github.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/785

The error I get on windows is the following:

>Cannot launch program 'c:\devel\src\MyWebKit\node_modules\.bin\webpack-dev-server'; setting the 'outFiles' attribute might help.

My current setup is:

>VSC: 1.9.1
>OS: Windows 10 Anniversary
>webpack: 2.2.1
>webpack-dev-server: 2.3.0

My configuration launch.json file:

    {
      "version": "0.2.0",
      "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/webpack-dev-server",
            "args": [
                "-d",
                "--config",
                "webpack/default.js"
            ],
            "outFiles": [
                "${workspaceRoot}/build/*"
            ],
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "console": "internalConsole",
            "sourceMaps": true
        }
      ]
    }

data.title: Set machineId in shared process
Scrolling lag and unresponsiveness
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Scrolling with a 'precision trackpad' one direction and then changing direction a few times suddenly scrolling becomes unresponsive and slow. Takes up to a second to start the scroll action from the touch and makes navigating a file very hard. This started recently. PC is a Dell XPS 13 Kaby lake model. 1080p at 125% zoom.
